name: SQL Injection
description: A code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability in an application's software.
impact: Unauthorized access to the database data leakage data modification and in some cases complete takeover of the system.
recommendations: Use prepared statements and parameterized queries Validate and sanitize all user inputs Use ORM frameworks that handle SQL injection protection.

name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
description: A vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into content from otherwise trusted websites.
impact: Hijacking user sessions defacing websites and redirecting users to malicious sites.
recommendations: Sanitize and validate all user inputs Use Content Security Policy (CSP) Encode data before rendering it in the browser.

name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
description: A type of malicious exploit of a website where unauthorized commands are transmitted from a user that the web application trusts.
impact: Performing unwanted actions on behalf of authenticated users such as changing account details or initiating transactions.
recommendations: Use anti-CSRF tokens Ensure that GET requests are idempotent Verify the origin of requests.

name: Insecure Deserialization
description: A vulnerability that occurs when untrusted data is used to abuse the logic of an application inflict a DoS attack or even execute arbitrary code.
impact: Remote code execution privilege escalation and application logic manipulation.
recommendations: Implement integrity checks or digital signatures on serialized objects Use a serialization format that enforces strict schema.

name: Security Misconfiguration
description: Improper configuration of security settings in applications frameworks servers or databases.
impact: Unauthorized access data leakage and compromised systems.
recommendations: Regularly review and update configurations Implement a secure baseline configuration Automate configuration management processes.

name: Broken Authentication
description: Weaknesses in authentication mechanisms that allow attackers to compromise user identities.
impact: Account takeover unauthorized access and data theft.
recommendations: Implement multi-factor authentication Ensure strong password policies and storage Monitor for and respond to authentication anomalies.

name: Sensitive Data Exposure
description: Inadequate protection of sensitive data such as financial information or personal data.
impact: Data breaches identity theft and regulatory fines.
recommendations: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit Implement strong access controls Regularly audit data storage and handling practices.

name: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
description: Incorporating libraries frameworks or other software modules with known vulnerabilities into applications.
impact: Exploitation of known vulnerabilities leading to various attacks.
recommendations: Regularly update and patch components Use automated tools to identify and manage vulnerabilities Monitor for announcements of new vulnerabilities.

name: Insufficient Logging and Monitoring
description: Lack of proper logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security incidents.
impact: Delayed detection of attacks prolonged breaches and inability to perform forensic analysis.
recommendations: Implement comprehensive logging of security-relevant events Regularly review and analyze logs Establish an incident response plan and conduct drills.

name: Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards
description: Failure to validate the URL or destination that the user is redirected or forwarded to.
impact: Phishing attacks and redirection to malicious sites.
recommendations: Avoid using redirects and forwards If necessary validate the destination URLs Use whitelisting of allowed destinations.

name: Buffer Overflow
description: Occurs when a program writes more data to a buffer than it can hold.
impact: Crash the system corrupt data and execute arbitrary code.
recommendations: Use languages with built-in bounds checking Implement stack canaries and ASLR (Address Space Layout Randomization) Regularly update and patch software.

name: Privilege Escalation
description: Exploiting a flaw to gain elevated access to resources.
impact: Full control of the system by unauthorized users.
recommendations: Implement the principle of least privilege Regularly update and patch systems Monitor for unusual account activities.

name: Denial of Service (DoS)
description: Attack aimed at making a service unavailable.
impact: Service outages and loss of productivity.
recommendations: Implement rate limiting and traffic filtering Use DDoS protection services Monitor network traffic for anomalies.

name: Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) Attack
description: Eavesdropping attack where communication between two parties is intercepted.
impact: Data interception and manipulation.
recommendations: Use strong encryption protocols (e.g. TLS) Implement mutual authentication Regularly update and patch software.

name: Phishing
description: Deceptive attempt to obtain sensitive information by pretending to be a trustworthy entity.
impact: Identity theft and financial loss.
recommendations: Implement email filtering solutions Conduct regular security awareness training Enable multi-factor authentication.

name: Malware
description: Malicious software designed to harm or exploit any programmable device or network.
impact: System damage data theft and loss of functionality.
recommendations: Use up-to-date antivirus software Regularly patch and update all systems Educate users about safe online practices.

name: Ransomware
description: Type of malware that encrypts the victim's files and demands a ransom.
impact: Data loss and financial extortion.
recommendations: Regularly back up data Use robust antivirus and antimalware solutions Educate users on recognizing phishing attempts.

name: Zero-Day Vulnerability
description: A previously unknown vulnerability that is exploited before a fix is available.
impact: Severe system compromise and data breaches.
recommendations: Implement intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDPS) Apply security patches and updates promptly Conduct regular security assessments.

name: Session Hijacking
description: Exploiting a valid computer session to gain unauthorized access.
impact: Unauthorized access to user accounts and sensitive data.
recommendations: Use secure session management practices Implement session timeouts and re-authentication Use HTTPS to protect session cookies.

name: Clickjacking
description: Malicious technique of tricking a user into clicking on something different from what the user perceives.
impact: Unintended actions such as changing settings or initiating transactions.
recommendations: Use X-Frame-Options header Implement frame busting techniques Educate users on the risks of clickjacking.

name: LDAP Injection
description: Exploiting input validation vulnerabilities in LDAP queries.
impact: Unauthorized access to directory data and possible data manipulation.
recommendations: Sanitize and validate all user inputs Use parameterized LDAP queries Implement least privilege access to directory services.

name: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
description: Exploiting vulnerable XML processors by including external entities.
impact: Data exfiltration DoS attacks and remote code execution.
recommendations: Disable XML external entity processing Use libraries that protect against XXE Sanitize and validate all XML inputs.

name: Directory Traversal
description: Exploiting insufficient security validation or sanitization of user-supplied input file names.
impact: Access to arbitrary files on the server.
recommendations: Validate and sanitize all user inputs Implement access controls to restrict file access Use secure coding practices.

name: Command Injection
description: Executing arbitrary commands on the host operating system via a vulnerable application.
impact: Complete system compromise and data theft.
recommendations: Validate and sanitize all user inputs Use safe APIs that avoid command execution Use least privilege for application processes.

name: Open Redirect
description: An application that accepts a user-controlled input that specifies a link to an external site, allowing attackers to redirect victims to malicious sites.
impact: Phishing attacks and redirection to harmful websites.
recommendations: Avoid using open redirects wherever possible Implement strict validation of redirect URLs Educate users about the risks of phishing.

name: Session Fixation
description: An attack that permits an attacker to hijack a valid user session.
impact: Unauthorized access to user accounts and sensitive data.
recommendations: Generate new session IDs after successful login Use secure mechanisms for session management Monitor session activity for anomalies.

name: HTTP Header Injection
description: Injection of unexpected HTTP headers into responses.
impact: Cache poisoning and cross-site scripting attacks.
recommendations: Validate and sanitize all user inputs, Encode and escape user-supplied content, Use security libraries and frameworks.

name: Session Token Disclosure
description: Disclosure of session tokens or session identifiers.
impact: Unauthorized access to user accounts and sensitive data.
recommendations: Encrypt session tokens in transit and at rest, Use secure mechanisms for token storage and transmission, Implement session token expiration and regeneration.

name: HTML Injection
description: Injection of untrusted HTML content into a web page.
impact: Cross-site scripting (XSS) and defacement attacks.
recommendations: Escape and sanitize user inputs before rendering, Use Content Security Policy (CSP) to restrict sources of executable scripts and styles.

name: Insufficient Transport Layer Protection
description: Lack of adequate encryption and integrity protection for data transmitted over networks.
impact: Man-in-the-middle (MitM) attacks and data interception.
recommendations: Use TLS/SSL for all communications, Disable insecure protocols and cipher suites, Regularly update SSL certificates.

name: Insecure Cryptographic Storage
description: Weak or improperly implemented cryptographic algorithms for storing sensitive data.
impact: Data breaches and exposure of sensitive information.
recommendations: Use strong encryption algorithms and key management practices, Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit, Regularly audit cryptographic configurations.

name: Session Timeout
description: Inadequate session timeout settings that allow sessions to remain active for extended periods.
impact: Session hijacking and unauthorized access to active user sessions.
recommendations: Implement appropriate session timeout periods based on application usage patterns, Notify users before session expiration, Implement re-authentication for sensitive operations.

name: Content Spoofing
description: Misleading users by presenting incorrect information.
impact: Phishing attacks and deception of users.
recommendations: Validate and sanitize all user inputs, Implement strict content validation and encoding, Educate users about content authenticity.
